A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
There are some good things going on in this movie but I am giving it a one star for really one reason\, but it is an important reason. I like Rian Johnson and I really enjoyed Looper. You can see he had themes here he wanted to explore. 
But this isn't just his film. There are a lot of fans that are invested in this series. There is real attachment to characters like Luke Skywalker. There is real attachment to questions that were posed in the first film. Who are Rey's parents? Who is Snoke? Why did Luke leave that map to himself? 
This movie says\, "screw all your expectations\, I'm doing my own thing." 
If you are not a fan of Star Wars you may enjoy this movie\, despite some odd seeming plot holes. If you are someone who feels invested in this universe you'll probably still see this movie but you might be disappointed with some of the decisions and abandoned subplots.
